2025 Catalyst Conversations This event has concluded! Thank you to everyone who attended the 2025 Catalyst Conversations Clio Health 2025 Catalyst Conversations Share: At this thought-provoking event, creative leaders and experts from the health industry and beyond will explore the latest trends shaping health marketing, sharing how transformative ideas and bold creativity are driving the future of the field. Reserve your spot (opens in a new window) Event Details November 18, 2025 05:00 pm EST Location Klick Health, West 40th Street, New York, NY, USA Choose Your Calendar Google Calendar ICS Calendar Close Agenda Speakers Gallery Contact Us Agenda 5:00 pm – 5:30 pm Check-In 5:30 pm – 7:00 pm Sessions – Patient-Centric Stories: How Pharma Brands Can Create for the Platform and the Consumer, presented by Pinterest Novartis has emerged as an industry leader in patient storytelling by creating platform-specific campaigns that resonate with their audience. This panel brings together thought leaders from Novartis and Pinterest to provide insight on how an in-house content studio and a bold media strategy allows Novartis to tell authentic patient stories that drive impactful marketing campaigns and improved health outcomes. Moderator: Kim Dolan, Managing Director, Pinterest Speakers: Elizabeth Madhok, Associate Director, Marketing Strategy US Oncology, Novartis Chelsea Marti, Director, Marketing, Novartis Amiyra Perkins, Sr. Lead, Creative Strategy, Pinterest Mona, Novartis Patient Ambassador – Crisis Communications: How to Talk About Suicide Prevention Hear from the voices leading local and national suicide prevention efforts about how creativity and compassionate marketing can make a life-changing difference for people in crisis. This session will explore how accessible messaging and actionable steps help to break down barriers, foster understanding, and build a community of support that saves lives. Moderator: Alexandra Cameron, Executive Vice President, Unified Partnerships Division, iHeartMedia Speakers: Allison Weinstock, Creative Director, DCG Communications Eduardo Sarmiento, President, Strategic Creative and Communications, Fors Marsh Dr. Kelly Posner Gerstenhaber, Professor of Psychiatry, Columbia University – The Art of Healing: Harnessing Creativity to Reduce Health Stigmas From body image and disability to inclusion and representation, some of the most pressing health and wellness topics still carry stigma. Creativity has the power to break through silence and spark conversations that change perceptions. This session explores how organizations are using bold, purpose-driven campaigns—from rethinking weight and wellness, to challenging outdated views of disability and adoption —to destigmatize sensitive issues and reach audiences in new ways. Panelists will discuss the creative strategies behind these efforts, the challenges of tackling subjects often left unspoken, and the lasting impact of shifting narratives through storytelling. Moderator: Bernardo Romero, Maker, Klick Health Speakers: Kelli Joy Richardson, CEO/Founder, House of Joy Dr. Omar A. Escontrías, Senior Vice President of Equity, Research and Programs, National Health Council Danny Stewart, Director of Operations & Finance, Safe Horizon 7:00 pm – 8:00 pm Networking Reception Past Speakers Allison Ceraso Chief Creative Officer, Digitas Health Kim Dolan Managing Director, Pinterest Christine Guilfoyle President, SeeHer Cara Kamanev Global Brand President, Stripes Beauty Christina Gutierrez-Williams Senior Director of Culinary R&D, Daily Harvest Ugur Kucukcetin Senior Executive in Professional Transition (Ex Novartis & Ex Novo Nordisk) Brian Robinson Global Chief Strategy Officer & GLP-1 Consultancy Lead, Havas Health Network Dr. Alexandra Sowa, MD, MA Physician, Founder of SoWell & Author of ‘The Ozempic Revolution’ Roger Sho Gehrmann Vice President, Integrated Partnerships, MassiveMusic Kay Hsu Head of Global Creative Lab, Spotify Cassandra Sinclair CEO, VCCP Health Sandie Bailey Co-President & Chief Innovation & Design Officer, Shondaland Chris DiIorio Co-President & Chief Marketing Officer, Shondaland Ramon Soto Senior Vice President & Chief Marketing Communications Officer, Northwell Health Michelle Hillman Chief Campaign Development Officer, The Ad Council Dr. Bayo Curry-Winchell 2x TEDx Speaker, Founder of Beyond Clinical Walls, Saint Mary’s Urgent Care Medical Director u0026 Physician, and Medical Contributor Kate Barchie Content Strategy Lead, Novartis Who Should Attend? Students Gain insider knowledge, learn meaningful tips, and hear from inspiring creators about what fuels their process. Early – Mid Career Professionals Make connections with other talented creatives and marketers that can help you build a professional community and set your career on the path to award-winning ideas. Industry Veterans Celebrate your passion for creativity and share your vision for the future of the industry with other brand and marketing leaders at the top of their game. Gallery Contact Us Event Inquiries Emily Seal Clio Health, Executive Director emily.seal@clioawards.com Sponsorship Inquiries Conall Ryan Senior Manager, Business Development conall.ryan@clioawards.com SPONSORS Presenting Sponsor Partners Host

2025 Clio Awards Creative Summit This event has concluded, thank you to everyone who attended the 2025 Clio Awards Creative Summit! The Clio Awards 2025 Clio Awards Creative Summit Share: The industry’s most celebrated and forward-thinking voices will gather to share the ideas, and practices that propelled their work to the forefront of the business. You’ll hear from today’s most inspiring visionaries about harnessing the power of creativity to unlock the potential of new technologies and so much more. View Gallery (opens in a new window) Event Details October 20, 2025 12:30 pm EST Location 195 Broadway 4th floor, New York, NY 10007, USA Choose Your Calendar Google Calendar ICS Calendar Close Agenda Speakers Who Should Attend? 2024 Event Gallery 2025 Agenda – Registration – Sound as Signature: How Holistic Music Strategy Shapes Brand Identity Presented by Universal Production Music Music isn’t just a background track, but one of the most powerful tools brands have to communicate identity and build lasting cultural relevance. This panel will explore the evolving role of music strategy in brand storytelling and how a cohesive, intentional approach to sound can define a brand just as distinctly as its logo or visual identity. Speakers: Jamie Glenn VP, Partnerships & Licensing Universal Production Music Zach Golden Creative Director Elias Audio Branding – Livestreaming Under the Influence…Of Brands Presented by Twitch Learn the balancing act of brand integration in livestreaming through hands-on experience. During this session led by Patrick Moses, the U.S. Creative Production Lead at Twitch Brand Partnership Studio, attendees will play branded games while exploring how creators navigate sponsored content without losing their authentic voice. We’ll analyze what makes branded content fall flat, what makes it feel forced, and how to find the sweet spot in between. Speaker: Patrick Moses U.S. Creative Production Lead Twitch Brand Partnership Studio – The Clio Awards x Luma AI In Conversation With AI Challenge Powered by Dream Machine Finalists Presented by Luma AI As the lines between creativity and technology blur, a new generation of storytellers is leading the charge – harnessing AI not as a shortcut, but as an opportunity for bold and original thinking. This roundtable discussion features three finalists of the AI Challenge Powered by Dream Machine, a first-of-its-kind collaboration between The Clio Awards and Luma AI, inviting creatives to explore what’s possible when the power of AI meets the art of advertising. Through 10-second vertical ads built with Luma’s Dream Machine, finalists will reflect on their creative process, the challenges and surprises of working with generative tools, and how AI is shaping the future of content creation for a new era of advertisers and audiences. Speaker: Jon Finger Creative Workflow Executive for Dream Lab, Los Angeles – Why Taste is Strategy: The Aesthetics of Influence In an era where attention is fleeting and loyalty is hard-won, brands who are engaging influencers to develop a distinct and consistent aesthetic are rising above the noise. This conversation explores how cultivating “taste” through content creators, visual identity, and cultural fluency is more than a creative decision, it’s a strategic one. We’ll examine how an intentional aesthetic can deepen brand loyalty, signal values, and drive long-term engagement. We’ll also highlight the brands setting the standard, from beauty to lifestyle to food, that are proving just how powerful good taste can be. Moderator: Ashley Rudder Co-Founder HAUS OF SÔS Speakers: Alex Booker Executive Creative Director BBDO New York Jeremy Elias Executive Creative Director Oatly Quynh Dang VP Brand Away – Repicturing Rural America: Tackling the Visual Gap and Driving Authentic Storytelling Presented by Getty Rural America has long been defined in marketing and advertising by outdated tropes that overlook its diversity, innovation, and cultural relevance. Tristen Norman, Director and Head of Creative for the Americas at Getty Images, will share data-driven insights and broader creative strategies to help brands challenge those stereotypes and be a catalyst for change. Drawing on Getty Images’ unique research approach through their VisualGPS insights platform, powerful visual examples, and extensive client partnerships to identify gaps, Norman will illustrate how brands can leverage visual storytelling to more accurately reflect various underrepresented communities and position them as a driving force in shaping the cultural and creative landscape of tomorrow. Speaker: Tristen Norman Director and Head of Creative for Americas Getty Images – Doing Well by Doing Good: Lessons from Patagonia’s Radical Playbook What does it take to build a wildly successful global brand rooted in purpose? Join author and New York Times climate reporter David Gelles in conversation with Patagonia’s in-house philosopher Vincent Stanley for a thought-provoking discussion on how Patagonia became a global leader in “doing well by doing good.” Explore how the brand’s bold, values-led approach is inspiring other companies to lead with integrity, responsibility, and long-term impact. A must-attend for anyone rethinking what brand leadership can—and should—look like. The first 175 attendees of this session will receive a FREE COPY of Gelles’s new book DIRTBAG BILLIONAIRE: How Yvon Chouinard Built Patagonia, Made a Fortune, and Gave It All Away. Stick around after the panel to have your book SIGNED BY THE AUTHOR. Speakers: David Gelles Author and New York Times Climate Reporter Vincent Stanley Director Patagonia Philosophy 5:00 pm – 6:00 pm Networking Reception/Raffle 5:00-6:00 PM – Networking Reception with light food and beverages. The first 175 attendees of the Creative Summit will receive a FREE COPY of David Gelles’s new book DIRTBAG BILLIONAIRE: How Yvon Chouinard Built Patagonia, Made a Fortune, and Gave It All Away. Stick around after the summit to have your book SIGNED BY THE AUTHOR. All attendees will also be eligible to win Apple AirPods Pro3 earbuds at the close of the event. You must be present to win so be sure to stay until the end! Speakers Alex Booker Executive Creative Director, BBDO New York Ashley Rudder Co-Founder, HAUS OF SÔS David Gelles Author, Reporter, New York Times Jamie Glenn VP, Partnerships & Licensing, Universal Production Music Jeremy Elias Executive Creative Director Jon Finger Creative Workflow Executive, Dream Lab Los Angeles Patrick Moses U.S. Creative Production Lead, Twitch Brand Partnership Studio Tristen Norman Director and Head of Creative for the Americas, Getty Images Vincent Stanley Director, Patagonia Philosophy Zach Golden Creative Director, Elias Audio Branding Quynh Dang VP Brand, Away Who Should Attend? Students Gain insider knowledge, learn meaningful tips and hear from inspiring creators about what fuels their process. Early – Mid Career Professionals Make connections with other talented creatives and marketers that can help you build a professional community and set your career on the path to award winning ideas. Industry Veterans Celebrate your passion for creativity and share your vision for the future of the industry with other brand and marketing leaders at the top of their game. Dr. Bayo Curry-Winchell - Dr. Bayo Curry-Winchell Back to Host Dr. Bayo Curry-Winchell Share: Dr. Bayo Curry-Winchell , known as Dr. Bayo (“bye-oh”), is a nationally recognized health equity and maternal health advocate. She is the founder of Beyond Clinical Walls, a platform offering credible health information through engaging social media and podcast content. She is the medical director of the urgent care clinics at Saint Mary’s Regional Medical Center in Reno, NV. She recently graduated from the One Million Black Women In Business program sponsored by Goldman Sachs and NYU School of Business. She is a healthcare ally advocating for improving healthcare inequalities by utilizing health literacy and providing tangible solutions to reduce the cost of care for healthcare companies. Dr. Bayo’s influence is not confined to her medical practice. Most recently, she was appointed to the national CDC Community and Public Engagement Workgroup. Her role as medical director at the Washoe County Sexual Assault Response Team is another example of her numerous contributions. She was also appointed to the Nevada Patient Protection Commission in addition to her role as the Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging co-chair for the Nevada State Medical Association. Dr. Bayo’s influence extends beyond her professional roles. As a national media contributor, prominent public speaker, and TEDx presenter, she has a platform to amplify her message. Her TEDx talk, ‘Do No Harm,’ has not only been a popular hit with over 2 million views but has also sparked a transformative conversation on maternal health and equity.

Emma Heming Willis - Specialty Awards 2025 Emma Heming Willis Back to Specialty Awards Clio Health 2025 Honorary Award Emma Heming Willis Author, Advocate and Co-Founder and Chief Impact Officer Make Time Wellness Share: Emma Heming Willis is a British and Indian/West Indian model, entrepreneur, advocate, wife, and mother of two and stepmother of three. She is the co-founder and Chief Impact Officer for Make Time Wellness, a brand dedicated to promoting women’s brain health. Emma hosts the Make Time Podcast, along with co-host and co-founder, Helen Christoni and the Make Time to Connect YouTube program, which is committed to bringing important information on cognitive wellness and dementia to those in need. In 2022, Emma’s husband, Bruce Willis, was diagnosed with frontotemporal dementia (FTD). Since then, she has become a passionate advocate for caregivers, tirelessly raising awareness about dementia and emphasizing the importance of brain health. Emma’s backing includes pushing for government action to formally recognize FTD’s unique impact on families, patients, and healthcare systems. Her ultimate mission is to see an end to FTD and all neurodegenerative diseases. Emma’s work has garnered widespread recognition from renowned media outlets and organizations. She was featured on this year’s cover of Town & Country’s Philanthropy Issue and named one of People Magazine’s “Women Changing the World.” Among her upcoming honors, she will receive the Honorary Clio Health Award. Emma is currently writing her first book, a deeply personal and richly compassionate support guide that helps caregivers care for themselves while they navigate a loved one’s illness. It will be published by Maria Shriver’s imprint, The Open Field at Penguin Random House on September 9, 2025.

2025 State of Play Sports Marketing Summit This event has concluded! Thank you to everyone who attended the 2025 Clio Sports State of Play. Clio Sports 2025 State of Play Sports Marketing Summit Citi Field Share: We are excited to announce that this year’s State of Play Sports Marketing Summit will be held at Citi Field! Join us for conversations, food, drinks, and a closer look at some of the most talked about happenings in sports marketing. You’ll hear from teams, leagues, brands, and media companies about how they’re leaning into disruption, expansion, and innovation to reach new audiences and build brand affinity with sports fans. It’s a must-attend event for champions of creativity at brands, teams, leagues, agencies, media, and social platforms. Please note: The programming will take place outside on the dugout and in the stands, weather permitting, so please dress appropriately. View Gallery (opens in a new window) Event Details May 20, 2025 Add to Calendar Location Citi Field, Seaver Way, Flushing, NY, USA Choose Your Calendar Google Calendar ICS Calendar Close Topics & Agenda Speakers Ticket Details Who Should Attend? Agenda 1:00 pm – 2:00 pm Check-In 2:00 pm – 5:00 pm Startups Aren’t Just For Tech Bros: How New Leagues Are Changing the Game This session will explore the recent success of several startup leagues that are disrupting the status quo and offering fresh takes on traditional sports by introducing new formats, technologies, and incentives for fans to tune in and cheer on. How does a new organization build a fanbase from the ground up? We’ll hear from the marketing leaders that made it happen for the most talked about new leagues in the industry. – Rethinking the Away Game: Lessons in Marketing Overseas Whether it’s a Brooklyn basketball team tipping off in Paris or a storied German soccer league opening its office doors in Rockefeller Center, there is value in showing up in unexpected places. In this session, you’ll hear from teams across the world of sports who are expanding their reach in international markets and growing their fanbase by marketing to an entirely new audience. – Going Long: How Storytelling Shapes Sports Culture Brands, athletes, and broadcasters alike have looked to sports documentaries for decades as a way to build a fanbase and share the untold stories of the road to success. In this panel, you’ll hear from filmmakers, producers, and other creative leaders who are credited with capturing the multifaceted stories of how athletes became icons, and how sports legends live their lives off the field. – New York Mets Gameday Experience Get a taste of the in-game action at Citi Field. Creative leaders from the New York Mets will offer attendees a look at the most exciting and engaging elements of the in-game experience. You may not arrive a fan, but by the end of the session we’ll have you rooting for the home team. 5:00 pm – 6:30 pm Stadium Tours + Networking Reception HOST: Karl Ravech Sunday Night Baseball Play-by-Play Commentator, ESPN Veteran ESPN commentator Karl Ravech is the voice of Sunday Night Baseball, ESPN’s exclusive, national Major League Baseball game of the week, calling games alongside analysts Eduardo Perez and David Cone and reporter Buster Olney. Ravech joined ESPN in May 1993. His three decades of covering MLB for the network have included hosting ESPN’s studio coverage of the MLB playoffs and World Series since 1995, hosting ESPN’s MLB studio and pre-game show, Baseball Tonight, and serving as play-by-play commentator for Monday Night Baseball and for ESPN’s 2020 KBO League season coverage. He has also been the voice of ESPN’s Home Run Derby telecast since 2017. Who Should Attend? Students Interested in Marketing Gain insider knowledge, learn meaningful tips, and hear from inspiring creators about what fuels their process. Early-to-Mid Career Professionals Make connections with other talented creatives and marketers that can help you build a professional community and set your career on the path to award-winning ideas. Industry Veterans Celebrate your passion for creativity and share your vision for the future of the industry with other brand and marketing leaders at the top of their game. Karl Ravech - Karl Ravech Back to Host Karl Ravech Sunday Night Baseball Play-by-Play Commentator ESPN Share: Veteran ESPN commentator Karl Ravech is the voice of Sunday Night Baseball, ESPN’s exclusive, national Major League Baseball game of the week, calling games alongside analysts Eduardo Perez and David Cone and reporter Buster Olney. Ravech joined ESPN in May 1993. His three decades of covering MLB for the network have included hosting ESPN’s studio coverage of the MLB playoffs and World Series since 1995, hosting ESPN’s MLB studio and pre-game show, Baseball Tonight, and serving as play-by-play commentator for Monday Night Baseball and for ESPN’s 2020 KBO League season coverage. He has also been the voice of ESPN’s Home Run Derby telecast since 2017. Since 2006, Ravech has provided commentary for ESPN and ABC coverage of the Little League World Series in Williamsport, Pa. In 2011, he added the Little League World Series Championship games and the College World Series to his yearly schedule. During the winter, Ravech is a play-by-play commentator on ESPN’s college basketball telecasts and has called the SEC basketball tournament since 2017. Ravech has also anchored ESPN’s college basketball studio wraps operation. Additionally, in the fall of 2000, Ravech followed Tiger Woods’ quest for the Grand Slam while hosting ESPN’s golf coverage at Pebble Beach, St. Andrews and Valhalla. In November of 1998, Ravech was playing a pickup game of basketball with friends from ESPN when he noticed a sharp pain in his chest. After receiving medical attention, the doctor informed Karl he had experienced a heart attack at the age of 33. “That experience was a wake-up call,” said Ravech. “Now, through exercise and proper diet, my heart is as strong as a professional athlete. I run every day. Who knows why these things happen, but it changed me for the better.” Prior to joining the network, Ravech served as the weekend sports anchor/reporter at WHTM-TV in Harrisburg, Pa. (1990-93). His assignments included the 1992 Senior U.S. Open golf tournament, Harrisburg Senators (Washington Nationals’ Double-A affiliate), and MLB spring training. He was nominated for a local Sports Emmy in 1990 and 1991. From 1987 to 1990, Ravech was employed by WBNG-TV, in Binghamton, N.Y., as a sports anchor/reporter with assignments including the 1988 U.S. Open golf tournament. Ravech served as the sports director at NewsCenter 7 in Ithaca, N.Y., and as a freelance sports producer for WCVB-TV in Boston (1986-87), while attending college. Ravech received his Bachelor of Science degree in communications from Ithaca College in 1987. He received his master’s degree in management and leadership in 1990, from SUNY at Binghamton.

Robert Alberino - Robert Alberino Back to Robert Alberino VP of Content and Production Kansas City Chiefs Share: Rob Alberino re-joined the Chiefs in 2021 as the Vice President of Content and Production after originally serving as the club’s Vice President of Media and Marketing for four years (2010-13). He enters his ninth season with the club and his 32nd season in the NFL in 2025. Alberino leads all content efforts, including creation and distribution across the club’s traditional, digital, social, and over-the-top platforms. He also oversees all aspects of game production, presentation, and entertainment elements at GEHA Field at Arrowhead Stadium. The 2022 season was the first time that Alberino oversaw a new division of production which helped launch the team and the brand into new international markets, as well as complete special projects and new long-form concepts. These efforts were delivered with best-in-class content to Chiefs fans in Germany and Mexico, helping grow Chiefs Kingdom overseas as well as expand the NFL’s international fanbase. In his first stint with the franchise, Alberino oversaw the club’s media partnerships and creation of the in-house production team, 65 Toss Power Trap Productions, as well as the team’s digital operations on Chiefs.com while playing a key role in the club’s marketing initiatives. Under Alberino’s direction, 65TPT garnered the franchise’s first 18 Emmy Awards, as well as became the first NFL club to win a prestigious New York Festival Award. He spent eight seasons (2013-20) as Vice President/Executive Producer for the San Francisco 49ers between his stops in Kansas City. With San Francisco, Alberino oversaw all marketing, creative and design, as well as the launch and direction of 49ers Studios, the team’s in-house production division. His group created all multimedia and broadcasts across all platforms, while he managed branding, events, social media and new media efforts. Prior to joining the Chiefs in 2010, Alberino spent 13 seasons with the Philadelphia Eagles (1997-2009) as Vice President of Broadcasting where he helped launch the Eagles Television Network, earning 38 Regional Emmys and more than 100 Tellys and other regional accolades. He spent three years (1995-97) as a filmmaker/producer with NFL Films where he was a writer/director for HBO’s “Inside the NFL.” In 2012, while with the Chiefs, Alberino was bestowed an honorary enlistment in the United States Army and continues to pay forward the honor by continually working alongside all branches of the military. He sits on the Board of Directors for The First Twenty, a non-profit dedicated to improving the performance, health, and safety of the American First Responder.

Sam Cryer - Sam Cryer Back to Sam Cryer Founder & CEO Intermission Film Share: Sam Cryer founded multi award-winning creative agency Intermission Films in 2012. Intermission’s team of over a hundred talented editors, designers, producers and writers based in London, Amsterdam, New York and Melbourne work across AV, key-art and social on a hugely diverse slate of campaigns for major studios, streamers, independents and filmmakers, including Dune 2, Drive To Survive, Black Mirror, House of the Dragon, Full Swing, The Crown, A Real Pain, Alien Romulus, Baby Reindeer and many more. The company also works directly with production companies from concept to screen helping shape brand identity from sizzle pitch, opening title sequences, throw forwards, in-show graphics, trailers and everything in-between. Sam has also produced features such as Charlotte Colbert’s critically acclaimed debut She Will, Rupert Russell’s “The Last Sacrifice” Ron Scalpello’s “Hurst” and is currently finishing sports con documentary feature “The King of Lies” for Sky UK

Ron Goldenberg - Ron Goldenberg Back to Ron Goldenberg VP, International Marketing & Innovation BSE Global Share: Ron Goldenberg is the Vice President of International Marketing & Innovation at BSE Global (parent company of Barclays Center, The Brooklyn Nets, and New York Liberty) where he is responsible for the company’s international and innovation efforts. Prior to joining BSE, Goldenberg worked at the NBA in corporate sponsorship and marketing, most recently leading the NBA’s marketing and events business in Canada.

Dee Kundra - Dee Kundra Back to Dee Kundra Managing Director (Americas) FC Bayern München Share: Dee Kundra leads and oversees the advancement of FC Bayern Munich’s strategic objectives in the Americas and works directly with the headquarters in Munich to drive organizational success. Kundra joined FC Bayern in 2017 as Head of Marketing & Communications to lead the club’s audience development and brand positioning strategy within North, Central, and South America. In that time, the club has successfully increased their Americas fan base and further established its brand in the region. Prior to joining FC Bayern, Kundra acquired a wealth of international experience holding senior roles at the New York Cosmos and Liverpool FC, as well as working on Barclays’ global sponsorship of the Premier League at Lexis Agency.

Stephanie Martin - Stephanie Martin Back to Stephanie Martin Chief Marketing and Communications Officer League One Volleyball (LOVB) Share: Stephanie Martin is the chief marketing and communications officer for League One Volleyball (LOVB, pronounced “love”), responsible for league-wide marketing, communications, content, social media, creative, events, and community relations. She has more than 25 years of executive and C-suite experience in communications, brand, marketing, and event production at Fortune 500 companies like Meta (formerly Facebook), The Home Depot, and Albertsons, and global sporting events such as the Super Bowl, America’s Cup, and Rugby World Cup Sevens. Prior to joining LOVB, Martin was senior vice president, head of communications for Dapper Labs, the Web3 company behind some of the most successful NFT experiences including NBA Top Shot, NFL Day, and UFC Strike. She also co-founded and ran the consultancy BFWD which helped athletes with their brand strategy, and nonprofit Athlete x Impact that helped athletes realize the impact they can have off the field of play. A frequent speaker, panelist, and moderator on sports, marketing, and brand strategy, Martin is a certified independent corporate director; an adjunct professor in brand and communications for the University of San Francisco’s Sports Management Masters program; a certified Myers-Briggs Type Indicator practitioner; and the co-author of the book Big Game, Bigger Impact: How the Bay Area Redefined the Super Bowl and the Lessons Learned that Can Apply to Any Business, which chronicles the hosting of Super Bowl 50. A student athlete at Tufts University on the school’s national championship-winning sailing team, Martin graduated with a B.A. in English, and received her M.A. in Communication Management from the University of Southern California.

Brendan McKeon - Brendan McKeon Back to Brendan McKeon Executive Director of In-Game Operations New York Mets Share: Brendan McKeon is the Executive Director of In-Game Operations at the New York Mets, producing and directing the in-game show for most Mets home games. This is his 20 th season with the Amazins, having started as an intern during the 2006 season. He believes that running a good team is of the utmost importance and focuses on bringing an engaging, immersive experience to each Mets home game. He is a proud graduate of Syracuse University.

Regina O’Brien - Regina O’Brien Back to Regina O’Brien Chief Marketing Officer TMRW Sports and TGL Share: An award-winning marketing and communications executive, Regina O’Brien oversees all marketing, communications, and creative strategies for TGL presented by SoFi, the new primetime, team golf league launched in the Winter of 2025. TMRW Sports marks O’Brien’s latest branding effort after serving as the head of Marketing and Communications for Augusta National Golf Club from 2020-2023. Prior to ANGC, O’Brien played significant marketing roles in several corporate and network initiatives for Comcast, including NBC Sports’ Golf Channel, Sprout, and Comcast Consumer and Hispanic Marketing.

Ian Orefice - Ian Orefice Back to Ian Orefice Founder and CEO EverWonder Studio Share: Ian Orefice is founder and CEO of EverWonder Studio, a full-service independent content studio and production company known for elevated nonfiction storytelling and live events. He leads all business strategy, IP development, and production across the company’s slate of documentary, live, experiential, brand partnerships, and more. Orefice, an Emmy, Peabody, and Webby Award winning producer and media executive, launched EverWonder Studio in the fall of 2023 with the backing of Jeff Zucker’s RedBird IMI. Prior to EverWonder, Orefice served as President and COO of TIME and its Emmy-winning production division TIME Studios, which he launched in early 2020. Under his leadership, TIME Studios grew to generate over $100 million in revenue with more than 20 projects sold including Netflix’s Jeen-Yuhs and Big Vape: The Rise and Fall of Juul, CNN Films’ John Lewis: Good Trouble, and the Time 100 specials for ABC. Orefice started his career as a producer for CNNMoney.com and Sports Illustrated. He is based in New York.

Kirby Porter - Kirby Porter Back to Kirby Porter Chief Brand Officer Unrivaled Basketball Share: Kirby Porter is a sports entrepreneur and brand builder, currently serving as the Chief Brand Officer at Unrivaled, a league built in collaboration with the biggest stars in women’s basketball. Prior to Unrivaled, Porter was the founder of New Game Labs, a company that connected athletes and technology through media and startup advisory services, and the first marketing hire at Will Ventures, an early-stage sports tech venture capital firm. A Harvard Women’s Basketball alumna, Porter was captain of the team and has pursued a career focused on empowering athletes beyond their sport. Her contributions have earned her recognition such as Forbes 30 Under 30, and Sports Business Journal’s New Voices Under 30 and Front Office Sports’ Rising 25.

Ed Romaine - Ed Romaine Back to Ed Romaine SVP, Head of Marketing + Brand Development TNT Sports Share: Ed Romaine is TNT Sports Senior Vice President, Head of Marketing + Brand Development. In this role he oversees the entire marketing organization of the TNT Sports portfolio including branded content, integrated strategy, product marketing, data strategy and operations, consumer marketing and marketplace opportunity. Prior to this role, Romaine served as the SVP, Chief Brand Officer of Bleacher Report, helping it to become the No. 1 partner for sponsored content in the sports market and the No. 1 partner by engagements for all digital video. Ed has invested his career in the development and implementation of compelling advertising and consumer solutions across digital, social, mobile, app, video, print, experiential, and linear platforms. He sets himself apart not only through his curation of great agency and client-direct relationships but also through core competencies including team building, ideation, monetization, detail-oriented sell through and execution as well as overarching brand strategy and creativity. Beginning his career in the music industry at Warner Music Group, Ed also optimized campaign performances for many Fortune 500 clients at Alloy Media + Marketing, Bauer Media Group and Hearst Media Corporation before serving five years at Conde Nast, overseeing Integrated Marketing + Sales Development at both W and GQ US divisions. In 2016, Ed was appointed Chief Marketing Officer at Kargo Global. His org at the company included product marketing, strategy, research, pr/social communications, creative services and global experiences. He hosted a podcast, Mobilizing Culture, available on iTunes and Google Play. He lives in New York City with his husband.

Josh Rosenman - Josh Rosenman Back to Josh Rosenman Senior Director of Creative Content New York Mets Share: Josh Rosenman is the Senior Director of Creative Content for the New York Mets. He’s passionate about pushing creative boundaries and constantly exploring new ways to evolve the Mets brand. It’s all about telling stories that connect, finding the emotion, energy, and originality that make this more than just a game. He loves experimenting, taking risks, and reimagining what Mets content can be, always with the goal of bringing fans closer to the heart of the franchise.

Will Ullman - Will Ullman Back to Will Ullman Senior Manager, Head of Sports Documentary Marketing Netflix Share: Will Ullman is an award winning creative marketing executive who currently leads the Sports Documentary Marketing team at Netflix. In his 6+ years at Netflix, he’s built the title brands and overseen the creative campaigns for titles like Quarterback, Full Swing, and Starting 5, and helped pioneer the live sports efforts at the company on projects like The Netflix Cup and Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson. Prior to his time at Netflix, Ullman spent over a decade at PlayStation Studios, where he built creative campaigns for sports franchises including MLB: The Show, Gran Turismo, and NBA: The Life, in addition to titles such as The Last of Us, Uncharted, and God of War. Ullman lives in Los Angeles with his wife and their two cats, where they all root for Ferrari and the Chargers, despite neither team making it easy.

Alan Cumming - Alan Cumming Back to Host Alan Cumming Tony Award-Winning Actor, Emmy Award-Winning Producer & Host, LGBTQ+ Activist Share: Alan Cumming is beyond eclectic. His most recent projects include hosting (and slaying fashion-wise) the global cultural phenomenon The Traitors, creating a solo dance theatre piece about the Scottish bard Robert Burns, lip-synching the protagonist in a documentary, and producing a podcast series about a sperm bank heist. He can be seen as Sigmund Freud in the film V13, as an elderly woman with a pet crab in the Disney kids series Robogobo, and heard in a duet with Gaelic rapper Griogair Labhruidh! Perhaps not surprisingly, Time Magazine called him one of the three most fun people in show business (the others were Cher and Stanley Tucci!) Thirty years ago his Hamlet stormed the West End and he was hailed as ‘an actor knocking at the door of greatness’. A quarter of a century ago he was a sensation as Cabaret ’s Master of Ceremonies in a production that forever changed the Broadway landscape. A decade ago his visceral, virtually one-man Macbeth was a stunning, transatlantic coup de theatre. His screenwork ranges from art house to blockbuster, cult to the mainstream, but his performances are always indelible and some immortal: “Mr. Floop” in Spy Kids , “Eli” in The Good Wife, Nightcrawler in X2: X Men United, “Sebastian” in The High Life , “O” in Sex and the City , “Boris” in Goldeneye, “King James” in Doctor Who , “Sandy Frink” in Romy and Michele’s High School Reunion , “Mayor Menlove” in Schmigadoon , and himself on Broad City . He is the author of seven books including a New York Times #1 bestselling memoir, performs in concert regularly in halls around the world, and co-owns his own, eponymous cabaret bar Club Cumming, a home for ‘all ages, all genders, all colours, all sexualities, where kindness is all and anything could happen!’ The list of his collaborators over the years includes Liza Minnelli, Jeremy O. Harris, Jackie Chan, the Smurfs, David Bowie, The Simpsons, Robert Wilson, Stanley Kubrick, Jay Z, Bianca Del Rio, the Spice Girls, George Lucas, Terence Blanchard, KT Tunstall and not forgetting Dora the Explorer, Arthur and Elmo. He had a photo exhibition named Alan Cumming Snaps! and an award-winning fragrance named Cumming . He has played Dionysus, the Devil, God, and the Pope and was shot by Herb Ritts for Vanity Fair as Pan. He recently played a 70-year-old woman. He has been a Lee Jeans model and on a stamp. He is a Tony and Olivier award-winning theatre actor. He hosted the Tonys and was nominated for an Emmy for doing so. In fact, he has been nominated for seven Emmys, winning two for his work as the host and producer of The Traitors, along with another New York Emmy, a Scottish BAFTA, and a British Comedy Award. He is an Independent Spirit award-winning producer and National Board of Review-winning director. He is a Grammy and multiple Golden Globe nominee. His portrait was hung in the Scottish National Portrait Gallery in the spot previously occupied by the Queen, who made him an O.B.E. (Officer of the British Empire) in her 2009 Honours List for his commitment to LGBT rights. He has four honourary doctorates and over forty awards for being a humanitarian, but as he says, ‘awards mean nothing!’ The 2025 Clio Awards Ceremony Hosted by Alan Cumming Join us as we present Grand Clio, Specialty and “Of the Year” Awards. Make sure you’re signed up for our newsletters so you don’t miss any announcements. Buy Tickets (opens in a new window)

2025 Catalyst Conversations This event has concluded! Thank you to everyone who attended the 2025 Clio Health Catalyst Conversations. Clio Health 2025 Catalyst Conversations Share: At this thought-provoking event, you’ll hear from creative leaders and experts from the health industry and beyond speak about transformative approaches to health marketing. In an era where patients and consumers are more empowered than ever, Clio Health will explore how advertising and marketing efforts are supporting disruptors in the marketplace, allowing them to deliver innovative healthcare solutions for consumers. Event Details April 24, 2025 05:00 pm EST Add to Calendar Location 375 Hudson Street, New York, NY, USA Choose Your Calendar Google Calendar ICS Calendar Close Agenda Speakers Gallery Contact Us 5:00 pm – 5:15 pm Check-In 5:15 pm – 7:15 pm Sessions – 2025: The Year of Disruption in Women’s Health and Advertising Women drive 80% of healthcare decisions, yet they remain underrepresented, misrepresented, and overlooked in pharma ads—only one-third accurately reflect them. That’s about to change. A wave of women’s health brands are rewriting the rules, pushing for more authentic, inclusive storytelling that resonates—and delivers results. The numbers speak for themselves: brands that get it right see up to 10x sales growth, a 43% boost in brand reputation, and a 22% increase in purchase intent. The opportunity for creativity to lead a sea change in the marketplace is massive. Advertisers who break from outdated tropes and embrace real representation will tap into a market demanding better—and they’ll win big. It’s time to stop playing catch-up and start leading the disruption. Moderator: Christine Guilfoyle , President, SeeHer Panelists: Allison Ceraso , Chief Creative Officer, Digitas Health Cara Kamenev , Global Brand President, Stripes Beauty Kim Dolan , Managing Director, Pinterest – GLP-1s Disrupting the Advertising Game Weight loss drugs aren’t just changing bodies—they’re flipping entire industries on their heads. With 1 in 8 adults now on GLP-1s and the market projected to explode to $150 billion by 2033, brands have a shot at reaching a new kind of consumer—one who is eating less, moving more, and rethinking everything from dinner to downtime. As appetite drives a shift in the way people shop, nimble marketers in every category have an opportunity to meet the moment. This panel will dive into the cultural ripple effect of weight loss drugs—and how creative leaders are helping to rebrand, reposition, and redefine what it means to be healthy in 2025. Moderator: Brian Robinson , Global Chief Strategy Officer, Head of Growth & GLP-1 Consultancy Lead, Havas Health Network Panelists: Christina Gutierrez-Williams, Director of Culinary R&D, Daily Harvest Ugur Kucukcetin, Global Pharma Executive (formerly Novartis & Novo Nordisk) Dr. Alexandra Sowa, MD, MA , Physician, Founder of SoWell and Author “The Ozempic Revolution” – Sound That Sticks: How Audio Supercharges Brand Recall in Pharma In a world where attention is fleeting and recall drives prescriptions, sound might be pharma’s secret weapon. Join an expert panel as they dive into the powerful intersection of neuroscience, memory, and audio. This isn’t just theory — it’s a practical look at how pharma brands like Ozempic, Theraflu, and Panadol are using sound to move from passive awareness to active recall. From memory pathways to emotional fluency, our panel will explore why sonic branding is still the most underleveraged tool in pharma marketing — and how the right audio strategy can drive trust, adherence, and long-term behaviour change. Moderator: Roger Sho Gehrmann , Vice President, Integrated Partnerships, MassiveMusic Panelists: Cassandra Sinclair , CEO, VCCP Health Kay Hsu , Head of Global Creative Lab, Spotify – A Very Bridgerton Brand Partnership: How Shondaland Is Using Co-Creation to Help Brands Own The Narrative In a fireside chat with Clio Health Executive Director, Emily Seal, you’ll hear from Shondaland co-presidents Chris DiIorio and Sandie Bailey about how the production company is disrupting the brand partnership arena. By teaming up with Flonase to co-create a multi-platform campaign, they cleverly played on plot lines, seasonality and product benefits to seamlessly integrate the OTC allergy relief medicine into the beloved world of Bridgerton. Moderator: Emily Seal , Executive Director, Clio Health Panelists: Chris DiIorio , Co-President & Chief Marketing Officer, Shondaland Sandie Bailey , Co-President & Chief Innovation & Design Officer, 2024 Clio Creative Summit This event has concluded, thank you to everyone who attended the 2024 Clio Creative Summit! The Clio Awards 2024 Clio Creative Summit Hosted by Omnicom Share: The industry’s most celebrated and forward-thinking voices will gather to share the tools, ideas, and practices that propelled their work to the forefront of the business. You’ll hear from today’s most inspiring visionaries about how to build a career that supercharges your strengths, harness the power of creativity to unlock the potential of new technologies and so much more. View Gallery (opens in a new window) Event Details October 28, 2024 12:30 pm EST Location Omnicom Media Group, 195 Broadway, New York, NY 10007, USA Choose Your Calendar Google Calendar ICS Calendar Close – Registration – Tech and Joy: Harnessing Technology to Celebrate Human Endeavor in Sports Presented by Michelob ULTRA Just as technology supercharges creativity by enabling new forms of expression, it can elevate sports by transcending the boundaries of human endeavor. Michelob ULTRA has been pioneering this concept, consistently pursuing the joy in sports while spotlighting talents and teams. Through engaging tech-infused experiences like ‘Lap of Legends’ – the first ever real vs. virtual race presented in a one-hour TV special – and many other award-winning works, the brand demonstrates that sports are all about the emotion they evoke. In this session, Michelob ULTRA and its partners at FCB NY, will discuss the role of technology in its campaigns and how it can be used to boost, not overshadow, the human elements of a brand’s story. Speaker: Alex Abrantes, ECD FCB New York – Building a Brand That is Time-less and Time-ly In order to stay relevant in today’s world, heritage brands must be willing to make bold choices that build on their past and shape their future. How does a century old organization keep things fresh? In this session, you’ll learn from creative leaders who are deploying timely partnerships, buzzy collaborations and out-of-the-box thinking that keep legacy products at the center of popular culture. Speaker: Simon Au, Executive Creative Director, The Kitchen @ Kraft Heinz Baldwin Cunningham, Director of Media and Partnerships, State Farm Matthew Low, SVP Creative Director, BBDO Joel Rodriguez, Head of Context Planning, Translation Moderator: Emily Seal, Executive Director, Clios – Streaming Synergy: Unlocking the Unique Value of the Creator-Viewer Relationship Presented by Twitch Livestream video viewership is on the rise. This comes as no surprise because live, influencer-led streams allow online communities to forge tight-knit connections and engage with like-minded individuals in meaningful ways. In this session, Steve Marzocca, Influencer Relations Lead, Twitch at Amazon Ads, will uncover ways brands can leverage live-streaming creators and their passionate communities to build trust, boost brand consideration, and authentically reach new customers. With the added perspective of a Twitch streamer, Steve will explore the various ways advertisers can leverage this powerful dynamic to create memorable branded moments with creator collaborations. Speaker: Steve Marzocca, Influencer Relations Lead, Twitch at Amazon Ads Carmela, Twitch Streamer – Break – Spotify: Think Like a Fan, Act Like a Creator Presented By Spotify Join this session to explore how brands and agencies can harness Spotify’s data superpowers to push creative boundaries and craft standout campaigns. We’ll dive into some of the latest award winning work from Spotify Advertising and FCB NY, which put some of those same creative principles into practice. Speakers: Rich Frankel, Global Creative Director, Spotify Advertising Jessica Levinsohn, Associate Director, Business Brand Marketing, Spotify Michael Aimette, Chief Creative Officer, FCB New York Danilo Boer, Global Creative Partner, FCB – B2B: From Boring2Blah to Bold2Brilliant Presented by Salesforce Scott Larson, SVP and Head of Global Brand Marketing and Creative at Salesforce will offer invaluable insights and strategies drawn from his extensive experience at both B2B and B2C brands. Speaker: Scott Larson, SVP & Head of Global Brand Marketing and Creative, Salesforce Read More About This Session – Social-First Marketing: How to Create Likable Campaigns with Shareability as the Centerpiece To break through and meet their metrics, creatives must think of social as the birthplace of content, not the distributor. The most successful campaigns are built with platforms–and the habits of their audience– in mind from the start. This panel will feature industry leaders who are delivering engagement and business results through clever conversations that influence consumer behavior. Speakers: Charlotte Tansill, President of PR, Social & Influence, Ogilvy North America Bridget Jewell, Executive Creative Director, Dentsu Creative Rob Lenois, Global Chief Creative Officer, VaynerMedia Lesley Parks, Executive Strategy Director, Social and Content, TBWA Moderator: Krystle Watler, Head of U.S. Integrated Marketing Communications, TikTok for Business – The Sonic Advantage: How Music & Sound Shapes Memorable Brands Presented by MassiveMusic In today’s oversaturated marketing landscape, branding has to go beyond just visual identity. Join the MassiveMusic team in an interactive session to explore the various ways in which sound and music can be used strategically to craft brands in an audio-centric era. Learn how tapping into the power of sound can form emotional bonds between brands and their communities – and reach new audiences – through authentic, sound-first storytelling.
